RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Professor Titular do Departamento de Ciкncia da Computaзгo do Instituto de Matemбtica da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro desde 2011. Possui graduaзгo em Engenharia Elйtrica pela UFRJ (1975), mestrado em Engenharia de Sistemas e Computaзгo pela COPPE/UFRJ (1981) e doutorado em Sistemas de Informaзгo - University of East Anglia (1986). Realizou pуs-doutorado na Santa Clara University (1994-1996) e na Universidade Politйcnica de Valencia (2004-2005). Em 2001 atuou como Professor Visitante da Universidade de Paris VI. Atua como pesquisador do Programa de Pуs-Graduaзгo em Informбtica da UFRJ. Tem experiкncia na бrea de Ciкncia da Computaзгo, com кnfase em Sistemas de Informaзгo, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: sistemas colaborativos, gestгo de conhecimento, engenharia de software e projetos de interfaces. Aplica suas pesquisas no domнnio de gestгo de Emergкncias. Й membro do Corpo Editorial das revistas: Journal of Interactive Learning Research, JISCRAM, Journal of Brazilian Computer Society e Journal of Decision Systems. Mantйm cooperaзгo regular com professores das universidades: Universidade Politйcnica de Valencia, Espanha, Ohio State University, EUA e o Rensselaer Polytechnic institute, EUA. Coordenou a organizaзгo do Congresso da SBC em 1988. Foi um dos fundadores do grupo de interesse em Engenharia de Software e do grupo de interesse em Sistemas Colaborativos, ambos da Sociedade Brasileira de Computaзгo. De 1987 a 1994 foi Secretбrio Executivo do Centro Latino Americano de Estudos em Informбtica (CLEI). Foi um dos fundadores do CRIWG e membro do Conselho de Administraзгo de 1995 atй 2012. Й membro do Conselho de Administraзгo da IEEE-CSCWD e do ISCRAM. Em 2016 organizou XIII ediзгo da Conferкncia Internacional sobre Sistemas de Informaзгo para a resposta e gestгo de crises (ISCRAM 2016). Foi Co-Chair do Comitк de Programa da Conferкncia ACM CSCW em 2017. Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa 1-D do CNPq (2016-2020) e Cientista do Nosso Estado da FAPERJ (2015-2018).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Full Professor of the Department of Computer Science at the Institute of Mathematics, Federal University of Rio de Janeiro. Graduated in Electrical Engineering from UFRJ (1975), M.Sc. in Systems Engineering and Computer Science from COPPE / UFRJ (1981) and Ph.D. in Information Systems - University of East Anglia (1986). He was a visiting scholar at Santa Clara University (1994-1996) and at the Polytechnic University of Valencia (2004-2005). In 2001 he was Visiting Professor at the University of Paris VI. He acts as a researcher at the Graduate Program in Computer Science of UFRJ. He has experience in Computer Science with emphasis in Information Systems, acting on the following themes: computer-supported collaborative work, knowledge management, software engineering and interface design. He orients his research to the application domain of emergency management. He is a member of the Editorial Board of the journals: Journal of Interactive Learning Research, Journal of JISCRAM and Journal of Decision Systems. Maintains regular cooperation with professors from: Polytechnic University of Valencia, Spain, Ohio State University, USA and Rensselaer Polytechnic institute, USA. He was the organization Chair of the Congress of the Brazilian Computer Society in 1988. He is one of the founders of the Special interest Groups in Software Engineering and in Collaborative Systems, both of the Brazilian Computer Society. From 1987 to 1994 he was the Executive Secretary of Centro Latino Americano de Estudos em Informбtica (CLEI). He was one of the founders of CRIWG (CRIWG - Collaboration Researchers International Working Group) and member of the Steering Committee from 1995 to 2012. He is also member of the Steering Committee of IEEE-CSCWD and of ISCRAM. In 2016 he was the Conference Chair of the 13th edition of the International Conference of Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management. He was Program Committee Co-Chair of ACM CSCW in 2017. Research Scholar level 1-D of CNPq and Scientist Scholar of Rio de Janeiro State.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Nos ъltimos 10 anos e especialmente nos ъltimos 4 anos, a minha vida acadкmica mudou bastante. Primeiro pelo retorno do pуs-doutorado na Espanha, que deu novo impulso ao domнnio (Gestгo de Emergкncias) onde estamos aplicando os resultados das nossas pesquisas em Gestгo do Conhecimento, Colaboraзгo e Sistemas Complexos. Como resultado alйm das publicaзхes, hб dois projetos importantes sendo tocados como centro de referкncias em tecnologia para a Gestгo de Emergкncias; um aprovado pelo CNPq em 2010 (PDI-Grande Porte) e outro pela FAPERJ em 2012 (Integraзгo de Programas de Pуs-Graduaзгo). Obtive tambйm a Bolsa de Cientista do Nosso Estado, oferecida por 3 anos pela FAPERJ a cerca de 900 cientistas, de todas as бreas, que atuam no Rio de Janeiro. Nos ъltimos cinco anos, com a abertura do curso de doutorado no PPGI, pude dar outra dimensгo no trabalho com os alunos de doutorado, que nгo orientava desde 2005. Atualmente oriento 9 alunos, a metade em co-orientaзгo dom outros professores. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Anбlise de Aplicaзхes para apoio ao Trabalho em Grupo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Muitas ferramentas de apoio ao trabalho em grupo vкm sendo desenvolvidas por grupos de pesquisa em CSCW (Computer-Supported Cooperative Work) para testar idйias e conceitos sobre os aspectos envolvidos no processo cooperativo. Desta forma, й importante realizar avaliaзхes sobre o uso destes produtos de software. As avaliaзхes, contudo, precisam ser conduzidas seguindo alguma metodologia para que os resultados sejam consistentes e possam subsidiar novas pesquisas. A literatura mostra que ainda nгo existe definiзгo de uma metodologia completa, necessбria para o estabelecimento do rigor cientнfico da бrea. O projeto de cooperaзгo entre os trкs paнses da Amйrica do Sul (Brasil, Chile e Argentina) propхe o trabalho conjunto para a definiзгo e refinamento de um mйtodo para avaliaзгo do uso de sistemas de apoio ao trabalho em grupo e a realizaзгo de experimentos que permitam a anбlise do comportamento das organizaзхes na utilizaзгo de aplicaзхes de suporte a cooperaзгo. Os grupos deverгo investigar as questхes relacionadas аs formas de avaliaзгo dos processos cooperativos em ambientes computacionais, planejar e executar avaliaзхes de sistemas desenvolvidos no contexto das suas pesquisas. Desta forma, os resultados obtidos deverгo contribuir para o estabelecimento de mйtodos para fundamentar a бrea de pesquisas em CSCW, alйm de agregar valor аs pesquisas dos trкs grupos envolvidos, que vкm trabalhando com focos diferentes, porйm complementares. A pesquisa contribuirб tambйm para o fortalecimento das parcerias entre os grupos, estabelecendo linhas comuns e intercвmbios de investigaзгo.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Avaliaзгo do Uso de Ambientes de Aprendizagem Cooperativa Apoiada por Computadores
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A бrea de pesquisas em Aprendizagem Cooperativa Apoiada por Computadores (CSCL- Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) estuda como a tecnologia computacional pode apoiar processos de aprendizagem promovidos pelos esforзos de estudantes trabalhando cooperativamente na realizaзгo de tarefas. Й uma бrea de pesquisas multidisciplinar, envolvendo pesquisadores de Ciкncia da Computaзгo, Educaзгo, Psicologia e Inteligкncia Artificial, e, apesar de relativamente recente, diversos trabalhos vкm sendo apresentados em conferкncias internacionais especнficas (CSCL'99, EuroCSCL'01, CSCL'02). Propostas para utilizaзгo de tйcnicas cooperativas em aprendizagem com apoio de tecnologia computacional defendem que, na prбtica de atividades em grupo, os estudantes tкm oportunidade de aprender sobre processos de grupos, sobre estratйgias pessoais em contraste com as de outras pessoas, sobre mъltiplas perspectivas de um mesmo tуpico, lideranзa, gerкncia de tarefas em grupo e comunicaзгo. O computador disponibiliza o suporte a comunicaзгo e colaboraзгo, provendo assistкncia ao processo de coordenaзгo, permitindo a criaзгo de situaзхes nгo factнveis no mundo real, rastreando as aзхes dos membros do grupo, que podem ser utilizadas para melhoria de estratйgias em soluзхes de problemas, e estimulando os processos mentais de aquisiзгo de conhecimento. Um problema significativo com o desenvolvimento e utilizaзгo de sistemas cooperativos para aprendizagem, chamados de groupware educacional, й a dificuldade na realizaзгo de avaliaзхes. A maioria dos sistemas de groupware й complexa e introduz uma sйrie de fatores que tornam os processos de avaliaзгo caros, e permitem pouca generalizaзгo dos resultados obtidos. Alguns dos principais fatores sгo exemplificados: o efeito da personalidade e comportamento dos membros na performance do grupo, o efeito das dinвmicas sociais, motivacionais, econфmicas e polнticas, e a importвncia do tempo nas interaзхes entre os membros do grupo (Grudin, 1988).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Contexto e Trabalho em Grupo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Quase todas as empresas usam algum tipo de aplicaзгo computacional. A maioria das mйdias e grandes empresas tambйm usa plataformas bem abrangentes de suporte а cooperaзгo, denominadas Ambientes Integrados de Cooperaзгo (ICE). Estes ambientes sгo usados para apoiar reuniхes, monitorar mensagens de correio, e para construir aplicaзхes customizadas. Estes ambientes e suas respectivas aplicaзхes sгo usadas por mais de 125 milhхes de pessoas no mundo inteiro e durante a dйcada de 90 foi o ambiente dominante em muitas grandes organizaзхes para dar apoio aos seus planos de apoio а colaboraзгo. Analisando esta situaзгo, nуs observamos que hб uma diferenзa muito grande entre a maioria das aplicaзхes, desenvolvidas para uso pessoal, e os sistemas colaborativos, projetados para apoiar equipes. Sistemas colaborativos atuais, por sua vez, nгo possuem flexibilidade, nгo sгo customizбveis e nгo dгo suporte a integraзгo e a percepзгo do contexto em que as aзхes se dгo. Em resumo, eles nгo oferecem suporte suficiente a gerкncia e execuзгo de processos de negуcios e de transaзхes no nнvel da corporaзгo em rede. Um dos principais problemas observados em aplicaзхes colaborativas й a ausкncia de informaзхes de contexto para apoiar a interaзгo entre os seus usuбrios, especialmente no nнvel da equipe e da organizaзгo. Nгo hб colaboraзгo efetiva sem um contexto comum a todos que estгo colaborando. Mas contexto й um conceito difнcil de abstrair num modelo simples, pois suas dimensхes sгo infinitas. Portanto, um grande desafio й como introduzir contexto em ambientes integrados de colaboraзгo. O projeto de colaboraзгo entre os pesuisadores brasileiros e franceses objetiva unir os conhecimentos nas бreas de trabalho cooperativo (CSCW) e Contexto, para avanзar na бrea de Contextualizaзгo da Colaboraзгo. O projeto tem como meta a produзгo de mйtodos, modelos e protуtipos de ferramentas computacionais de apoio.

As pesquisas nesta бrea tкm proporcionado a construзгo de sistemas mais ъteis e бgeis para apoiar os objetivos principais da gestгo de emergкncias, que й a reduзгo de perdas humanas, perdas materiais e danos ao ambiente. Entretanto, sistemas de gestгo de emergкncias sгo ainda muito bбsicos e fazem pouco uso das tecnologias de informaзгo mais avanзadas. A computaзгo mуvel tem demonstrado seu enorme potencial de facilitar o acesso e a disseminaзгo de informaзгo, bem como a comunicaзгo entre pessoas e entre pessoas e sistemas. Entretanto, a integraзгo das facilidades disponibilizadas pela computaзгo mуvel com sistemas de informaзгo ainda й muito incipiente. Hб um amplo espaзo a ser explorado para trabalhos com esta visгo mais integrada. O ambiente e as ferramentas desenvolvidas serгo utilizados experimentalmente com equipes ligadas а resposta a emergкncias, como o Corpo de Bombeiros, o SAMU e a Defesa Civil.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Sistemas de Suporte ao Tratamento de Situaзхes de Emergкncia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O desenvolvimento de Planos de Emergкncia apresenta duas dificuldades fundamentais. A primeira tem sua origem principalmente na estrutura dos Planos de Emergкncia. Existe uma diversidade tгo grande de organizaзхes que, a priori, tentar cobrir todos os tipos com uma ъnica ferramenta geraria confusгo desnecessбria aos usuбrios da mesma. Pode parecer muito mais viбvel estabelecer, a partir das caracterнsticas especнficas de cada organizaзгo, a estrutura do Plano de Emergкncia a desenvolver, e proporcionar as ajudas especнficas para a elaboraзгo de deste plano. Nesse sentido, se trata de oferecer serviзos configurбveis para a elaboraзгo de Planos de Emergкncia baseados na classificaзгo das diferentes organizaзхes que gerem uma estrutura adequada аs necessidades de cada organizaзгo.
A segunda dificuldade afeta, sobretudo a especificaзгo do conteъdo e a representaзгo que se faz do mesmo nos Planos de Emergкncia: a diversa capacidade tecnolуgica das organizaзхes. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Nъcleo de Pesquisa de Sistemas Computacionais Complexos para a Gestгo de Emergкncias
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto visa criar o Centro de Referкncia para Sistemas de Gestгo de Emergкncias, que sгo sistemas tipicamente complexos e que tratam grandes volumes de informaзгo em tempo real, para apoiar as decisхes e operaзхes das equipes de controle e operaзгo. Este centro funcionarб como um polo de conhecimento para o suporte de tecnologia da informaзгo para todas as fases de uma emergкncia, desde a sua prevenзгo atй a investigaзгo, passando pelas fases de planejamento, preparaзгo, resposta e recuperaзгo. Com a proximidade temporal de eventos de grandes conglomeraзхes, tais como a Copa do Mundo e as Olimpнadas, й muito importante que as organizaзхes que lidam com emergкncias estejam preparadas para elaborar e cumprir planos de aзгo em caso de incidentes e acidentes. O centro de referкncia irб funcionar como um centro de pesquisa e desenvolvimento e de treinamento nos diversos nнveis, tanto estratйgico, como operacional. O centro terб forte interaзгo com organizaзхes de emergкncia, tais como o Corpo de Bombeiros e a Defesa Civil, seja para especular soluзхes na Gestгo de Emergкncias, seja para treinar pessoal de nнvel de comando destas organizaзхes. No aspecto tйcnico hб de se destacar os estudos na gestгo de sistemas complexos, trabalhado de forma multidisciplinar na computaзгo. Nesta primeira iniciativa, o projeto de criaзгo do NuPes-SCC-GE irб envolver de forma direta as бreas de Engenharia do Conhecimento, a principal base do grupo GRECO, Trabalho Cooperativo, Redes e Sistemas Distribuнdos, Visualizaзгo e Interfaces e Engenharia do Trabalho Cognitivo. O resultado esperado й um conjunto de estudos e soluзхes para a Gestгo de Emergкncias a partir do suporte computacional.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Engenharia, Colaboraзгo e Visualizaзгo do Conhecimento aplicados а Gestгo de Emergкncias
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Conhecimento й fundamental em situaзхes de emergкncia. A adequada gestгo do conhecimento nestas situaзхes й um fator diferencial que pode salvar vidas e reduzir perdas materiais e ambientais. Os sistemas de gestгo de emergкncias tкm caracterнsticas diferentes dos sistemas tradicionais de gestгo de conhecimento devido a premissa de tempo muito curta e as conseqькncias de decisхes equivocadas. Por estes e outros motivos o tema merece um tratamento diferenciado com o desenvolvimento de soluзхes prуprias deste domнnio. O projeto aqui proposto visa o estudo dos problemas relacionados аs fases de uma emergкncia e o desenvolvimento de soluзхes tecnolуgicas a fim de oferecer o conhecimento necessбrio а tomada de decisхes no comando e аs operaзхes em campo. O projeto constrуi sob a base gerada em projetos anteriores iniciados hб cerca de 10 anos, quando proponente e o grupo de pesquisa GRECO comeзaram a trabalhar com o tema. Nesta fase do projeto nуs iremos nos dedicar a trкs frentes de trabalho. A primeira frente estб relacionada а utilizaзгo da informaзгo prйvia disponнvel para apoiar o entendimento e a contextualizaзгo da situaзгo. A segunda frente jб iniciada nos projetos anteriores estб na captura de informaзгo contextual corrente enviada pelas equipes atuando no campo e pela populaзгo. O enfoque continua sendo na utilizaзгo de dispositivos mуveis que enviarгo e receberгo informaзхes das equipes de comando. A terceira frente estб relacionada com a visualizaзгo e manipulaзгo de informaзхes de forma colaborativa, utilizando mesas multi-tбcteis. O intuito й desenvolver protуtipos para apoiar as atividades de comando e de percepзгo da situaзгo e avaliar como a colaboraзгo se dб neste ambiente de trabalho. Estarб incluнdo tambйm o aspecto cognitivo do trabalho em grupo utilizando este tipo de artefato.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Knowledge is critical in emergency situations. Proper knowledge management in these situations is a differential factor that can save lives and reduce material and environmental losses. Emergency management systems have different characteristics from traditional knowledge management systems due to very short time premise and the consequences of bad decisions. For these reasons the issue deserves special treatment with the development of own solutions in this domain. The project proposed here is to study the problems related to the phases of an emergency and the development of technological solutions in order to provide the knowledge necessary for decision making in command and operations in the field. The project builds on the foundation generated in previous projects started about 10 years ago, when the applicant and the GRECO research group began working with the theme. At this stage of the project we will devote ourselves to three fronts. The first front is related to the use of prior information to support understanding and contextualization of the situation. The second front that has already begun in previous projects is the capture of current contextual information sent by the teams working in the field and the public. The focus remains on the use of mobile devices that send and receive information from the command teams. The third front is related to the viewing and manipulation of information in a collaborative manner, using multi-touch tables. The aim is to develop prototypes to support control activities and perception of the situation and assess how collaboration takes place in this environment. It will also be included the cognitive aspect of group work using this type of artifact.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Engenharia, Colaboraзгo e Visualizaзгo do Conhecimento aplicados а Gestгo de Emergкncias

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Nъcleo de Pesquisa sobre Documentaзгo e Anбlise de Emergкncias para apoiar aзхes de: prevenзгo, preparaзгo, resposta e recuperaзгo de desastres
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Os desastres, naturais ou tecnolуgicos, provocam uma interrupзгo grave do funcionamento normal de uma comunidade ou sociedade, cujos efeitos nas pessoas, assim como as perdas e danos materiais ou ambientais, superam a capacidade de reposta e de recuperaзгo dessa comunidade ou sociedade. O objetivo central deste projeto й a criaзгo de um nъcleo de pesquisa de gestгo de emergкncias sob a уtica principal do apoio ao registro documentacional e analнtico das fases de emergкncia, mais especificamente a prevenзгo, o planejamento e preparaзгo, a resposta e a recuperaзгo. Este nъcleo interdisciplinar serб formado inicialmente por grupos nas especialidades de tratamento da informaзгo, visualizaзгo, educaзгo, ergonomia, anбlise cognitiva, saъde pъblica e vigilвncia em saъde e funcionarб como um polo de desenvolvimento de conhecimento nas бreas relacionadas aplicados а gestгo de emergкncias. O objetivo deste centro й se tornar um embriгo de uma rede de conhecimento no Rio de Janeiro no desenvolvimento de conhecimento para o tratamento de emergкncias. O Nъcleo pretende desenvolver aзхes para atingir os seguintes objetivos especнficos: 1. Criar e manter uma biblioteca de informaзхes sobre acidentes, desastres e as aзхes de emergкncias relacionadas; 2. Criar sistemas integrados de informaзхes reunindo dados de diferentes instituiзхes sobre emergкncias e desastres (principalmente instituiзхes de monitoramento de ameaзas naturais, defesa civil, meio ambiente, saъde pъblica, entre outras) e disponibilizem para diferentes pъblicos (pesquisadores, gestores e cidadгos). 3. Desenvolver indicadores que possibilitem relacionar mudanзas socioambientais, desastres, impactos sobre a saъde e polнticas de reduзгo de riscos de desastres. 4. Registrar o resultado de anбlises multicritйrio dos casos registrados na biblioteca para servir de referкncia аs equipes de emergкncia; 5. Criar um site de acesso para disseminaзгo das informaзхes da biblioteca e de outras iniciativas de sistemas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Disasters, natural or technological, causing a severe disruption of the normal functioning of a community or society, whose effects on people, as well as losses and material or environmental damage, beyond the capacity of response and recovery for the community or society. The central objective of this project is to create a core of emergency management research under the main optical supporting the documentacional and analytical record of the emergency phase, specifically the prevention, planning and preparedness, response and recovery. This interdisciplinary core will initially be formed by groups in information handling skills, visualization, education, ergonomics, cognitive analysis, public health and health surveillance and act as a pole of development of knowledge in areas related applied to emergency management. The objective of this center is to become an embryo of a knowledge network in Rio de Janeiro in the development of knowledge for the treatment of emergencies. The Center aims to develop actions to achieve the following specific objectives: 1. Create and maintain a library of information on accidents, disasters and actions related emergencies; 2. Create integrated information gathering data from different institutions on emergencies and disasters (mainly monitoring institutions of natural hazards, civil defense, environment, public health, among others) and deliver systems for different audiences (researchers, managers and citizens). 3. Develop indicators that allow to relate environmental changes, disasters, impacts on health and disaster risk reduction policies. 4. Record the results of multi-criteria analyzes of cases registered in the library for reference to first responders; 5. Create an access site for dissemination of library information systems and other initiatives.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo da Colaboraзгo na Aceleraзгo da Transferкncia de Conhecimento
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto trata de um problema que preocupa enormemente as organizaзхes e para o qual nгo hб soluзгo satisfatуria. Trata-se da transferкncia de conhecimento de especialistas e gerentes para outras pessoas da organizaзгo que poderгo substitui-las quando estes especialistas deixarem as organizaзхes. O projeto visa estudar e desenvolver soluзхes que acelerem esta transferкncia de conhecimento atravйs da utilizaзгo do enfoque de equipes colaborativas que possam utilizar o conhecimento adquirido do especialista da mesma forma que o seu processo cognitivo. O problema й complexo pois lida com capturar e transferir conhecimento tбcito, que nгo й fбcil de formalizar, especialmente quando se trata dos processos cognitivos. O enfoque que propomos estudar й a anбlise das melhores prбticas para esta transferкncia de conhecimento e que envolvam a aceleraзгo atravйs da utilizaзгo de equipes especialistas. Espera-se com isso reduzir a vulnerabilidade gerada pela perda de especialistas em organizaзхes que dependem fundamentalmente do conhecimento destes especialistas e nгo podem esperar um tempo muito grande para substituн-los. Com o apoio de mйtodos e processos cognitivos, bem com a utilizaзгo de ferramentas computacionais, espera-se alcanзar este objetivo em tempo reduzido. O projeto adotarб um enfoque experimental de refinamento sucessivo do processo e da tecnologia de apoio para avanзar na soluзгo do problema.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The project addresses an issue that greatly worries the organizations and for which there is no satisfactory solution. It is the knowledge transfer specialists and managers to others in the organization that could replace them when these experts leave their organizations. The project aims to study and develop solutions to accelerate this transfer of knowledge by using the approach of collaborative teams that can use the knowledge gained from the specialist the same way as their cognitive process. The problem is complex because it deals with capture and transfer tacit knowledge, which is not easy to formalize, especially when it comes to cognitive processes. The approach that we propose to study is the analysis of best practices for this transfer of knowledge and involving acceleration through the use of specialist teams. It is hoped that reduce vulnerability caused by the loss of specialists in organizations that depend fundamentally on the knowledge of these experts and can not wait a very long time to replace them. With the support of cognitive methods and processes, as well as the use of computational tools, it is expected to achieve this goal in a short time. The project will adopt an experimental approach of successive refinement of the process and support datecnologia to advance in solving the problem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Estudo da Colaboraзгo na Aceleraзгo da Transferкncia de Conhecimento

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Programa de Pуs-Graduaзгo em Informбtica (PPGI) IM&NCE

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Suporte а Elaboraзгo e а Execuзгo de Planos Complexos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O processo de planejamento e a posterior execuзгo do plano pode se tornar uma tarefa bastante complexa quando o alvo sгo situaзхes com alto grau de incerteza e de stress. Estes sгo os casos dos Planos de resposta a desastres, que envolvem vidas humanas e grandes perdas materiais. Nestas situaзхes й muito comum a necessidade de adaptaзгo e atй de improvisaзгo quando os planos inicialmente elaborados se mostram inadequados para enfrentar a evoluзгo das emergкncias. Й possнvel amenizar o trabalho de adaptaзгo de planos com a geraзгo de planos mais flexнveis que proporcionem facilidades para modificaзхes de acordo com a evoluзгo da situaзгo. Para identificar a necessidade de adaptaзгo й necessбrio um monitoramento da evoluзгo do desastre que identifique rapidamente a inadequaзгo. Ademais, й necessбrio prover as equipes de Comando e Controle (C&C) de ferramentas que facilitem a adaptaзгo de planos de maneira rбpida e eficaz. Este й um dos objetivos deste projeto: apoiar a elaboraзгo de planos flexнveis que sejam mais fбcil de adaptar frente a situaзхes nгo previstas nos planos. Como se preparam as equipes de C&C para estas situaзхes? Dado o contexto em que estas situaзхes se inserem, й praticamente impossнvel alйm do custo elevado utilizar situaзхes reais para o treinamento dos especialistas. Alйm disso, as situaзхes e os eventos diferem muito para que seja possнvel transportar o conhecimento de uma experiкncia anterior para uma eventual situaзгo futura. Assim, esta aquisiзгo de conhecimento requer ambientes de simulaзгo onde as aзхes de adaptaзгo de planos possam ser exercitadas e avaliadas. Assim, o segundo objetivo deste projeto й gerar um ambiente de simulaзгo e avaliaзгo com cenбrios prуximos da realidade a fim de analisar como as ferramentas de apoio desenvolvidas ajudam ou nгo a adaptaзгo de planos. O terceiro objetivo tem a ver com os aspectos cognitivos envolvidos no trabalho em equipe para executar adaptaзхes e improvisaзхes. Este objetivo tem um grande grau de complexidade e hб dъvidas se ele pode ser alcanзado. Em outras palavras, se as observaзхes realizadas nestes processos serгo ъteis para gerar ferramentas de apoio a estas funзхes. E mais importante, se й possнvel desenvolver conhecimento na equipe que gere resultados eficazes. O projeto adotarб um mйtodo baseado em ?Design Science Research?, pois o conhecimento da equipe do projeto nгo й suficiente para de inicio gerar ambientes com um mнnimo de confianзa no suporte adequado. Alйm disso, o rigor da avaliaзгo й muito importante se a pesquisa pretende gerar artefatos e modelos de fato ъteis para o trabalho crнtico e complexo que й o de resposta a emergкncias. O projeto terб duraзгo de 3 anos e envolverб alйm do pesquisador proponente do projeto, mais 4 professores e cerca de alunos dos cursos de doutorado e mestrado do Programa de Pуs-Graduaзгo em Informбtica, e alunos de graduaзгo do curso de Ciкncia da Computaзгo, ambos da UFRJ.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The process of planning and subsequent implementation of the plan can become a complex task when the target are situations with a high degree of uncertainty and stress. These are the cases of disaster response plans that involve human lives and high material losses. In these situations it is very common the need to adapt and even improvise when the plans drawn up initially show inadequate to handle the evolution of emergencies. One can ease the work of adaptation with the generation of more flexible plans that provide facilities for changes according to the mutable situation. To identify the need to adapt the monitoring of the evolution of disaster is required in order to quickly identify inadequacy. Moreover, it is necessary to provide the command and control teams (C & C) tools that facilitate plans ́ adaptation quickly and effectively. This is one of the objectives of this project: supporting the development of flexible plans that are easier to adapt in face of unforeseen situations. How the C&C teams can be prepared to these situations? Given the context in which these situations fall, it is virtually impossible to use actual situations for the training of specialists, besides its high cost. In addition, situations and events are very different and hence very difficult to carry the knowledge of previous experience to future situations. Thus, the acquisition of knowledge requires simulation environments where adaptation of action plans can be exercised and evaluated. The second objective of this project is to generate a simulation and evaluation environments which uses scenarios closer to reality in order to analyze how to developed supporting tools for helping the adaptation of plans. The third objective has to do with the cognitive aspects of teamwork to perform adaptations and improvisations. This goal has a great degree of complexity and there are doubts whether it can be achieved. In other words, if the observations made in these processes will be useful to generate support tools for these functions. And more important, whether or not it will be possible to develop knowledge that generates effective results. The project will use a method based on "Design Science Research", because the knowledge of the project team is not sufficient to start producing simulation environment with a minimum of confidence of proper support. In addition, the evaluation accuracy is very important if the research intends to generate artifacts and de facto useful models for critical and complex work which is the emergency response. The project will last three years and will involve beyond the project proponent researcher, 4 more faculty members and some students of doctorate and master ́s degree at the Graduate Program in Computer Science, and graduate students in Computer Science course, both at UFRJ.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Suporte а Elaboraзгo e а Execuзгo de Planos Complexos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Suporte Computacional а Adaptaзгo de Planos Complexos durante a sua execuзгo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O processo de planejamento e a posterior execuзгo do plano pode se tornar uma tarefa bastante complexa quando o alvo sгo situaзхes com alto grau de incerteza e de stress. Nestas situaзхes й muito comum a necessidade de adaptaзгo e atй de improvisaзгo quando os planos incialmente elaborados se mostram inadequados para enfrentar a evoluзгo das emergкncias. Assim, й necessбrio prover as equipes de Comando e Controle (C&C) de ferramentas que facilitem a adaptaзгo de planos de maneira rбpida e eficaz. Este й o objetivo principal deste projeto: apoiar a adaptaзгo de planos que estгo em execuзгo para fazer frente a situaзхes complexas nгo previstas nos planos. O projeto se propхe a estudar os conceitos, mйtodos, processos e ferramental para apoiar as equipes de coordenaзгo na execuзгo de planos complexos em que as aзхes tem um alto grau de interdependкncia. A pesquisa envolve principalmente aspectos computacionais para lidar com situaзхes complexas e apoiar a colaboraзгo nos processos de adaptaзгo e improvisaзгo que levarгo a porб situaзгo sob controle. A pesquisa serб aplicada ao domнnio da resposta a emergкncias e adotarб inicialmente um enfoque de design Science devido ao pouco conhecimento sobre o tipo de apoio adequado nestas situaзхes. Este projeto й uma sequкncia do projeto de pesquisa (produtividade) anterior que alcanзou bons resultados de pesquisa e de aproximaзгo com os organismos de gestгo de desastres.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work in Design (CSCWD 2010)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: The 14th International Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work in Design (CSCWD 2010)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The natural disasters occurred recently became one of the main press reports, especially the lack of adequate tools to manage emergency response. One of the aspects observed is the participation of field teams in the resolution of a crisis situation, mostly limited in sending information and executing tasks. Despite the importance of this communication, it is necessary to improve the interaction. Few studies have focused on how the operative use of information technology will affect the Command and Control System. More over, the development of more robust of new technologies and new mobile devices indicate new opportunity for the field teams to use information technology to support their activities. This paper presents a proposal of an information system to support interaction between emergency response teams and to evaluate their impact in a response organization.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The natural disasters occurred recently became one of the main press reports, especially the lack of adequate tools to manage emergency response. One of the aspects observed is the participation of field teams in the resolution of a crisis situation, mostly limited in sending information and executing tasks. Despite the importance of this communication, it is necessary to improve the interaction. Few studies have focused on how the operative use of information technology will affect the Command and Control System. More over, the development of more robust of new technologies and new mobile devices indicate new opportunity for the field teams to use information technology to support their activities. This paper presents a proposal of an information system to support interaction between emergency response teams and to evaluate their impact in a response organization.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Collective Intelligence for the Design of Emergency Response
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Collective Intelligence for the Design of Emergency Response

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work in Design (CSCWD 2010)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: The 14th International Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work in Design (CSCWD 2010)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Collective Intelligence has received much attention in recent years, as organizations and businesses discover the power of crowds. With new technologies, such as blogs, twitter, wikis, photo sharing, collaborative tagging and social networking sites, people may create and disseminate content as never before. Many organizations are looking for ways to harness this power, which is being called collective intelligence. Additionally, many opensource initiatives have shown that it is possible to obtain high quality results from collectively produced work. In this paper, we consider the domain of emergency response. We have been working in this domain for a few years now, mostly focusing on small disaster relief groups and field command. One of the command problems is lack of information about the location where the disaster occurred. We believe some of this information could be crowdsourced, changing current practices and enabling more effective response to the situation. In this paper, we discuss the possibilities for crowdsourcing and present an initial proposal for harnessing collective intelligence for the fire department.

In this paper, we discuss the possibilities for crowdsourcing and present an initial proposal for harnessing collective intelligence for the fire department.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Artigo Trabalho LACCIR
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Urban emergency situations require accurate and timely decisions in order to reduce the impact of these incidents on human lives and civil property. Decision making in this time critical scenario is a challenging task because there are several variables influencing the process, and some of them change quickly. This process characteristic requires that decision makers monitor and adjust their decisions almost permanently until the situation is under control. Therefore, information availability and understandability become a key issue to improve the decision making process. This paper presents two decision support systems that implement a decision making model. The model helps determine which information must be used to support the decision making process, and also how frequently such information must be updated. The systems are intended to help allocate ambulances and fire trucks to urban emergencies.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The paper presents a collaborative ethnography approach for knowledge elicitation of work teams in complex environments. It discusses the concepts of cognitive systems, distributed cognition, and presents a review of methods commonly used in the elicitation of knowledge both in the case of traditional and complex environments. Then, it points to some advantages of a collaborative approach in comparison to other non-collaborative approaches. An evaluation plan of the collaborative ethnography approach based on experimentation, and the development of a mobile system to support the proposed methodology is also presented. This system aims to stimulate collaboration and an organization in the ethnographic knowledge elicitation process.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The paper presents a collaborative ethnography approach for knowledge elicitation of work teams in complex environments. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Document product lines: variability-driven document generation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Document product lines: variability-driven document generation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ACM symposium on Document Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 10th ACM symposium on Document Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper, we propose a process model, which we call Document Product Lines, for the intensive generation of documents with variable content. Unlike current approaches, we identify the variability sources at the requirements level, including an explicit representation and management of these sources. The process model provides a methodological guidance to the (semi)automated generation of customized editors following the principles, techniques, and available technologies of Software Product Line Engineering. We illustrate our proposal with its application to the intensive generation of Emergency Plans.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper, we propose a process model, which we call Document Product Lines, for the intensive generation of documents with variable content. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Method for Identification and Representation of Business Process Deviations

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: CRIWG - International Conference on Collaboration and Technology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nowadays, process management represents a fundamental initiative to provide competitive advantages to organizations. The ability to build and operate such processes can provide competitive advantages to these organizations. In this paper, we present an approach for elicitating and discovering problems in business processes that combines the technique of group storytelling with the theory of constraints. This article suggests that group storytelling allows the collection of knowledge to identify the gaps and deviations that exist in business processes, while the theory of constraints provides a language for representing them. We conducted and reported an experimentation of the proposed method in the petroleum field sampling process, with the support of a groupware tool.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays, process management represents a fundamental initiative to provide competitive advantages to organizations. The ability to build and operate such processes can provide competitive advantages to these organizations. We conducted and reported an experimentation of the proposed method in the petroleum field sampling process, with the support of a groupware tool.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Supporting the Decision Implementation Process
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Supporting the Decision Implementation Process

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: CRIWG - International Conference on Collaboration and Technology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As the environment becomes competitive, organizations must develop the ability to quickly adapt to changes, becoming flexible and responsive. The decision making process should be quicker and more assertive, leading to action. Organizations need to make the right choices and implement them as decided. It is important that organizations be aware of the implementation of decisions and its impact. Monitoring the implementation of the decision and analyzing its results is the main way of assessing the decisive process itself. Extensive work has been done on decision making, but not on decision implementation. The goal of this research is to increase adherence of the implementation to the decision made. Given that large sums of money are spent on the decision making phase, implementations that do not adhere to the decisions may lead to undesired results, frustrating decision makers. In this paper, we present a method and a system to support decision implementation. With this research, we seek to contribute to the decision making process, specifically during implementation phase.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Simple and Portable Command Post to Coordinate Search and Rescue Activities in Disaster Relief Efforts

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: CRIWG - International Conference on Collaboration and Technology
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The lack of communication channels and support information can make the critical search and rescue of survivors after a disaster an ineffective process resulting in losses. This work addresses this problem by proposing a simple and portable command post application based on mobile devices and ad-hoc networks. The application provides support to communication and collaboration aiming to speed up the SAR process. The system architecture and some implementation issues are also presented.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraзгo pъblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Emergency plans play a central role in emergency management processes. However, the technical problems associated to emergency plan development have received very little attention. As a matter of fact, most emergency plans are printed documents prepared with the sole support of a word processing system. As a consequence, new media are the exception in current plans. Moreover, the plans are developed without any methodological support that guides planners through the plan development process. In this paper we introduce DPL(EP), a method for the development of emergency plans. Based on the Document Product Lines process for the development of variable content document families, its main goal is to provide methodological guidance and tool support for the development of emergency plans. The distinguishing characteristics of the method are: first, the use of feature models to describe variability in emergency plan content and in the representation of the plan components; second, the ?one organization-one plan? philosophy of the development process that produces customized plan editors; and third, its product line nature that enforces reuse of information elements, making plan development more convenient.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Emergency plans play a central role in emergency management processes. In this paper we introduce DPL(EP), a method for the development of emergency plans. Based on the Document Product Lines process for the development of variable content document families, its main goal is to provide methodological guidance and tool support for the development of emergency plans. The distinguishing characteristics of the method are: first, the use of feature models to describe variability in emergency plan content and in the representation of the plan components; second, the ?one organization-one plan? philosophy of the development process that produces customized plan editors; and third, its product line nature that enforces reuse of information elements, making plan development more convenient.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Events that threatens the status quo must be appropriately managed in order to reduce risk and bring the situation back to normal in a speedy fashion. In general, there is a lack of up to date information in emergency situations, this could be alleviated through the use of contextual information generated by social media sites. In this paper, we propose a model for social media information collection, which could be used by official organizations as an alternative communication channel aimed at reducing the distance between society and the command room.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Scenarios are cornerstones of emergency plan development because they help emergency managers envision a hypothetical real situation that may occur in the future. Scenarios are composed of events, but this is not enough to reach their entire potential. The use of scenario variables along with CIA-ISM approach can be used to support the generation and interrelation of events, expanding thereby the analysis of a scenario with situations closest to reality. The more people involved in generation, the better is the result (scenario) reached. This first step of a work-in-progress in emergency plan generation aims at facilitating the collaborative scenario creation by emergency experts with the adoption of both, variables and the CIA-ISM.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The evolution of communication channels and social networks proliferation through the web are inspiring and enabling the construction of collaborative environments. This article proposes an architecture of processes that aims to identify information responsibilities within a general emergency scenario, considering a new way of data provenance: citizens and government agencies. Citizens, who experience as victims a chaotic scenario, can also act as collaborators, providing relevant and useful information for the decision-making process. Today, they already do this informally, sharing public interest information through social networks, such as the Tweeter. The architecture also provides procedures for treating reliability and credibility of the information, provided by the so-called ?anonymous officials?, subjecting it to a filtering and verification process. The heterogeneity of information formats is a well-known problem that affects organizations and communities that wants to access public data. The architecture includes a Linked Open Data (LOD) approach for acquisition and integration of data maintained by government agencies that adopt different publishing standards. A solution to this problem is of particular importance to emergency response organizations that need access to all information available to better respond to disasters and crisis.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In major disasters it is common to install command posts close to the affected areas, in which a unified command, composed by people with different skills and goals, works together to resolve the situation. A major difficulty when supporting this command post is filtering the information that should be available and providing it at the right time to the right people. Through the application of Cognitive Task Analysis methods, we elicited how the work is really done and how the information is used by the command staff. Based on the results of this analysis, we present a set of requirements to support collaboration and information availability in this type of situation. We also present the initial development steps of a system prototype that will support the command post activities.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraзгo pъblica, defesa e seguridade social
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Administraзгo pъblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Simulation of accidents at nuclear power plant is designed to anticipate problems and unexpected situations. In a accident a large volume of information arrives disorderly and demands that decisions be taken quickly under pressure. This context asks for a system that supports decisions made jointly by the agencies responsible for the containment of the accident which has occurred. In order to study the emergency response process, we analyze the video and audio recordings of a simulated accident at a nuclear power plant in Brazil with the purpose of identifying cognitive requirements to build a future decision support system. In this work, we applied the methodology Applied Cognitive Work Analysis (ACWA), which was created with the objective of integrating the Cognitive Task Design and Software Engineering for the development of decision support systems.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Encouraged by many e-Government programs, the volume of Linked Open Data (LOD) is growing every day. With all these data, the citizens and industry are having a great opportunity to be aware of their community and to have an active participation in Governmental decisions. However, transforming data into useful information requires data to be relevant, reliable and interrelated, making the process of publishing data a complex and challenging task. Many automatic approaches are being used to address that, but still with little citizen intervention. In addition to these automatic processes, we propose a collaborative environment that is sensitive and adaptative to citizensґ opinions and dynamic needs. It supports several types of direct or indirect collaborations, over linked data elements, including individual contributions, comments mined from Social Networks or issues discussed in forums. Moreover, an exploration interface is designed to provide analytical data to decision-making processes, empowering citizens and improving e-government initiatives.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This proposal rises from the Center for Disasters Scientific Support experience over eleven years supporting over a hundred disasters in Latin America. It also presents a case study applied to landslides assessments in Teresуpolis (Brazil) city, when all field-generated knowledge was still registered in paper and later, at the base station, uploaded to database and finally available for managers evaluation and decision. The proposed methodology creates a platform (still under development) which allows online registration from different field agents during their evaluations enabling data upload combining mobile devices and telecommunication network (or Wi-Fi) technologies. Teams can also customize forms for different information classes (i.e. landslide assessment, rescued person, blocked road) and still retain the possibility to attach images, videos, other files related to each inspection. Incoming data are stored into a web database available for a real-time coordinators evaluation wherever they are (sometimes over a thousand of miles away from disaster area).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: SAGA: an Integrated Architecture for the Management of Advanced Emergency Plans

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference for Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 9th International Conference for Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Despite the significant advances that software and hardware technologies have brought to the emergency management field, some islands remain where innovation has had little impact. Among them, emergency plan management is of particular relevance due to their key role in the direction of teams during responses. Aspects like coordination, collaboration, and others are spread in plain text sentences, impeding automatic tool support to improve team performance. Moreover, administrative management of plans becomes a mere document management activity. In this paper, we present SAGA, an architecture that supports the full lifecycle of advanced emergency plan management. By advanced we mean plans that include new types of interaction such as hypermedia and advanced process definition languages to provide precise specification of response procedures. SAGA provides all the actors involved in plan management a number of tools supporting all the stages of the plan lifecycle, from its creation to its use in training drills or actual responses. It is intended to be instantiated in systems promoted by civil defense agencies, providing administrative support to plan management; additionally, editing tools for plan designers and tools for analysis and improvement of such plans by organizations are provided. Plan enactment facilities in emergency response are also integrated. To our knowledge, it is the very first proposal that covers all the aspects of plan man-agement.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Many mobile applications are developed every day. One important application domain is the Emergency Management. The use of mobile devices by emergency teams can play an important role during the response phase, where fast actions are essential. Applications in this domain can use mobile devices to support awareness, communication, coordination and collaboration, the four pillars of team work. In many cases, however, mobile devices are introduced only in substitution of radio communication. To enhance the use of mobile devices in emergency management a framework is needed to ensure that communication tools are built with the essential features for effective communication between teams and skilled emergency response. The goal of this paper is to assist software developers in dealing with communication problems in the development of mobile applications to support the emergency response.

The goal of this paper is to assist software developers in dealing with communication problems in the development of mobile applications to support the emergency response.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Design is a knowledge intensive activity, which depends on information to be undertaken. Previous designs, recent innovations, new techniques and materials must be taken into account when working on a new project, whatever its nature. Designing a plan is no different from designing a physical artifact, in that several constraints and requirements must be taken into account. Therefore, a collaborative approach that enables the refinement of plans through Public Engagement is of paramount importance to the design process. Many studies have been undertaken regarding the promotion of public participation in the planning process. In this situation, the population can be seen as an important source of information, because they experience the environments addressed by the proposed plan on a daily basis. However, the interaction between government and population presents cultural, political and technological challenges. In this paper, we present the Scenario-Based Collaboration Process (SBCP), which aims to Refine Plans through Public Engagement.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: DPLfw: A Framework for Variable Content Document Generation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: DPLfw: A Framework for Variable Content Document Generation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Software Product Line Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 16th International Software Product Line Conference - SPLCґ12

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Variable Data Printing solutions provide means to generate documents whose content varies according to some criteria. Since the early Mail Merge-like applications that generated letters with destination data taken from databases, di erent languages and frameworks have been developed with increasing levels of sophistication. Current tools allow the generation of highly customized documents that are variable not only in content, but also in layout. However, most frameworks are technology-oriented, and their use requires high skills in implementation-related tools (XML, XPATH, and others), which do not include support for domain-related tasks like identi cation of document content variability. In this paper, we introduce DPLfw, a framework for variable content document generation based on Software Product Line Engineering principles. It is an implementation of the Document Product Lines (DPL) approach, which was de ned with the aim of supporting variable content document generation from a domain-oriented point of view. DPL models document content variability in terms of features, and product line-like processes support the generation of documents. We de ne the DPLfw architecture, and illustrate its use in the de nition of variable-content emergency plans.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Critical scenarios, such as emergency response, generally involve groups of people that alternate between collocated and remote work. Groups are composed of small teams and a number of decisions are made while these smaller teams are working separately, in different locations. These decisions may impact not only each others? work, but also team safety and the outcome of the activity as a whole. Decision making in these situations involves a lot of uncertainty and groups have to trust each other to provide crucial information and to carry out orders in the best possible way.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Emergency environments are a particular case of safety critical environments. Not only are they unsafe, they change quickly and in unanticipated ways. Critical scenarios, such as emergency response, generally involve groups of people working both remotely and collocated. While individuals normally know each other at the outset, groups breakout into smaller teams and a number of decisions are made while these smaller teams are working separately, in different locations. These decisions may impact not only each others? work, but also team safety and the outcome of the activity as a whole. Decision making in these situations involves a lot of uncertainty and groups have to trust each other to provide crucial information and to carry out orders in the best possible way.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraзгo pъblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The growing use of mobile devices by the population and the high popularity of the social media in current society, such as Facebook and Twitter, produces more and more information, plenty of them with contextual data. One of the major obstacles to the emergency response team during the response phase of emergency management is to obtain information that could lead to solving a particular situation involving emergency victims. In this paper we present a proposal which aims to collect information from social media and mobile devices, identify the contextual information and analyze them to indicate people who could help in the identification of victims. This work focuses on identifying the social network of victims and look for people who can provide important and reliable information about them, thus assisting the emergency team in its work. We use this contextual information to improve the recommendation process, identifying people with high degree of closeness.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraзгo pъblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The undefined flow of execution of activities in an evaluation process hampers its implementation. A consistent evaluation process defines interrelated methodological steps that make it easier for the evaluator to lead the process. This article presents a process model for the evaluation of simulated field exercises in the emergency domain, including their sub processes and activities. The proposed model was derived from observations made during real situations of a simulated evacuation exercise of communities in high-risk areas in Rio de Janeiro (Brazil). The motivation came from the finding that the assessment of simulated field exercises is conducted by completing an activity report that does not follow a structural model, an evaluation program or a formal standard. The results of this research show the experts? satisfaction with the application of the model proposed for the development of an evaluation process. The same occurs when comparing to reports currently used by them for this purpose.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Emergency plans are developed to serve as a basis for response actions required in real situations. However, plan development is not an easy task and usually relies on complex processes. Due to the uncertainty of emergencies, one of the most challenging tasks is the development of possible courses of action. To deal with this uncertainty, we propose the use of scenario techniques for the definition of courses of action. Specifically, we adopt the use of CIA-ISM scenario technique for structuring the chain of events that can occur in a crisis that would support planning teams to develop courses of action. A practical application of the methodology has been successfully conducted by an emergency planning team in Brazil. The practical application of the CIA-ISM process was supported by a software artifact called CAEPlan. Lessons learned about the empirical application of both the methodology and the software artifact are presented.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraзгo pъblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An emergency plan is an important artifact used throughout emergencies. Therefore, it is crucial that this plan covers the different scenarios faced by emergency team and that the prescribed procedures generate the desired results. To achieve these goals, emergency plans need to be exhaustively tested prior to its adoption. Emergency teams usually use simulation to test plans, but it is an expensive approach, demanding the building of complex environments and tools to get realistic situations. To be ready to go through a simulation exercise, a plan should not have many or critical mistakes, otherwise the simulation exercise would be wasted. We present a paired approach to evaluate emergency plans before simulation exercises, by applying software engineering testing techniques: formal technical review (FTR) and mutation testing. The expected result is a plan more ready to go through simulation, as many of the mistakes are eliminated prior to simulation.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: One of the keywords in scientific research is collaboration, because closer relationships facilitates the exchange of knowledge, reduces the search time and resources required for its implementation. A collaborative work has less chance of error and has greater visibility. Scientific collaboration is also very encouraged by educational institutions and research funding agencies. However, scientific collaboration has still some challenges. Collaboration can vary according to several factors, such as the culture of the country, its economic situation, the area of study. The academic community has been studying collaboration issues in order to find better solutions to support and encourage collaboration among researchers. This work presents an environment that supports scientific collaboration, so that researchers can find potential research partners that work on closer topics and who seems to have common interests. It is intended to provide interaction between researchers in order to improve, streamline and enhance the results of scientific collaboration.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A tecnologia estб cada dia mais presente na geraзгo digital por meio do fбcil acesso а internet e a popularizaзгo dos dispositivos mуveis. Com isso, a escola necessita inserir na sua prбtica atividades que envolvam tecnologia e que possibilite que os alunos aprendam com novas praticas inovadoras que incentive a colaboraзгo. Esse artigo tem por objetivo apresentar uma pesquisa aplicada com alunos do oitavo ano de uma escola municipal do Rio de Janeiro que visou а inserзгo do wiki em uma atividade jб realizada nas aulas de portuguкs: a construзгo coletiva de um jornal. Na seзгo 1 serб apresentada uma breve introduзгo do que motivou essa pesquisa abordando os conceitos de aprendizagem colaborativa e escrita colaborativa. A seзгo 2 apresenta o contexto de aprendizagem colaborativa. Para o estudo (seзгo 3) foi utilizada a metodologia estudo de caso. Por meio da analise dos resultados (seзгo 4) de log do wiki, questionбrio e entrevista com o professor conclui-se que o wiki pode apoiar a dinвmica na construзгo do jornal. Porйm, boa parte da dinвmica e colaboraзгo dos alunos foi realizada de forma presencial, nгo sendo ainda adotada a colaboraзгo pelo sistema.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Technology is every day more present in the digital generation through easy access to the Internet and the popularization of mobile devices. With this, schools need to insert in their practice activities that involve technology and enables students to learn with new and innovative ways that encourage collaboration. This article aims to present a research applied in a Rio de Janeiro with eighth grade students. It aimed to evaluate the insertion of a computer support collaboration toll, a wiki, in an activity already performed in Portuguese classes: the collective construction of a newspaper. Section 1 presents a brief description about the motivations of this research addressing the concepts of collaborative learning and collaborative writing. Section 2 presents the context of collaborative learning. For the study (section 3) was used case study methodology. Through the analysis of the wiki results log (section 4), questionnaires and interviews with the teacher concludes that the wiki can support dynamic construction of the school newspaper. However, much of the dynamics and collaboration of students was conducted face-to-face. It is not yet adopted through the collaboration system.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 11th International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: There is an urgent demand for information systems to gather heterogeneous information about needs, donations and warehouse stocks to provide an integrated view for decision making in humanitarian logistics. The dynamic flow of information, due to the unpredicted events, requires adaptive features. The traditional relational data model is not suitable due to its schema rigidity. As an alternative, Graph Data models complemented by semantic representations, like Linked Open Data on the Web, can be used. Based on both, this research proposes an approach for the adaptive integration of information and an associated architecture. An application example is discussed in a real scenario where relief goods are managed through a dynamic and multi-perspective view.

The dynamic flow of information, due to the unpredicted events, requires adaptive features. The traditional relational data model is not suitable due to its schema rigidity. As an alternative, Graph Data models complemented by semantic representations, like Linked Open Data on the Web, can be used. Based on both, this research proposes an approach for the adaptive integration of information and an associated architecture. An application example is discussed in a real scenario where relief goods are managed through a dynamic and multi-perspective view.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 11th International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: On the way to the improvement of Emergency Plans, we show how a structured specification of the response procedures allows transforming static plans into dynamic, executable entities that can drive the way different actors participate in crisis responses. Additionally, the execution of plans requires the definition of information access mechanisms allowing execution engines to provide an actor with all the information resources he or she needs to accomplish a response task. We describe work in progress to improve the SAGA?s Plan definition Module and Plan Execution Engine to support information-rich plan execution.

Additionally, the execution of plans requires the definition of information access mechanisms allowing execution engines to provide an actor with all the information resources he or she needs to accomplish a response task. We describe work in progress to improve the SAGA?s Plan definition Module and Plan Execution Engine to support information-rich plan execution.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: SUCRE: Supporting Users, Controllers and Responders in Emergencies
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: SUCRE: Supporting Users, Controllers and Responders in Emergencies

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 11th International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We use the term ?Personal Safety Assistants? (PSAs) to refer to a family of mobile information systems that intend to reduce the risks of both citizens and responders in emergency responses. Using their mobile devices, they can access to personalized views of the emergency plans including context-aware evacuation instructions or real time guidance to specific locations for rescue operations, among others. Additionally, both responders and citizens act as context sources sending fresh information (e.g. pictures of damaged areas) to the command and control center, increasing situational awareness. In this paper, we show how the SUCRE infrastructure collects and processes contextual information to improve the information infrastructure during responses. We describe the current status of the system and outline the incoming enhancements.

Using their mobile devices, they can access to personalized views of the emergency plans including context-aware evacuation instructions or real time guidance to specific locations for rescue operations, among others. Additionally, both responders and citizens act as context sources sending fresh information (e.g. pictures of damaged areas) to the command and control center, increasing situational awareness. In this paper, we show how the SUCRE infrastructure collects and processes contextual information to improve the information infrastructure during responses. We describe the current status of the system and outline the incoming enhancements.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Stop Disaster Game Experiment with Elementary School Students in Rio de Janeiro: Building Safety Culture
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Stop Disaster Game Experiment with Elementary School Students in Rio de Janeiro: Building Safety Culture

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 11th International Conference on Information Systems for Crisis Response and Management

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This article describes a research on seriou games to raise awareness of risky situations endangering the children of Rio de Janeiro. In recent years - specially in the summer of 2011 - heavy rains hit the mountainous region of Rio de Janeiro, resulting in floods and landslides that killed hundreds of people and caused economic losses estimated at one billion dollars, it was the largest natural disaster in the history of Brazil. This major event triggered a lot of actions based on Hyogo framework in order to prepare the population for emergencies and to create a culture to deal with risky situations involving children given that this is a very important issue. In this research we invited children aged 10 to 13 years old, residents of the city of Rio de Janeiro, to play the educational game called 'Stop Disasters', which was developed by the UN in order to create a safety culture related to emergency preparedness. To verify if the game really improves the awareness of risky situations, the experiment was conducted with two groups: experimental and control. The experimental group used the ?Stop Disaster? game, while the control group did not. The latter answered a questionnaire before playing the game, and after that, answered another one with some questions that had been previously asked. They were also able to contribute with their opinions concerning issues such as game play, the missions, and game scenarios. The control group answered the same questionnaires, but without the questions about the game. The results show that serious games are able to develop children?s skills to deal with emergency situations, and that their use should be improved to create and develop a safety culture for emergencies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Construction and Evaluation of a Collaboration Observation Model

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Collaboration and Technology (CRIWG 2014)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computes Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This article proposes a Collaboration Observation Model (COM) to allow a systematic observation of aspects involved in collaboration, in order to facilitate coordination of observation activities in the group as well as to improve collaboration, interaction and communication among participants. Effective collaboration is a key factor of success in teamwork activities to achieve shared goals, because it can improve the quality of interactions and reduce tasks execution time. To evaluate the proposed model, a real experiment was conducted to verify its adequacy to collaborative aspects and to refine the model.

To evaluate the proposed model, a real experiment was conducted to verify its adequacy to collaborative aspects and to refine the model.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: JEMF: A Framework for the Development of Mobile Systems for Emergency Management

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Collaboration and Technology (CRIWG 2014)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In recent years, Emergency Management has become the target of multiple research efforts. This domain is characterized by collaborative aspects and several researchers discuss the use of mobile applications to complement traditional forms of information sharing. However, there is little software reuse in proposed solutions, as very few projects have focused on developing reusable components. Reusing components is desirable for it harnesses the strengths of existing systems, speeds up development and increases system reliability. In this paper, we present a framework to support software reuse in mobile systems development, based on specifications from the emergency domain. It provides guidance for the construction of new systems and simplifies their development, as required by the developers.

This domain is characterized by collaborative aspects and several researchers discuss the use of mobile applications to complement traditional forms of information sharing.
